section.heading: Illegal Use of Drugs and Alcohol.

para.text: The purpose of these regulations is to define and elaborate on the State's policy that employees are prohibited from the illegal use of drugs and from using or being under the influence of alcohol while on duty.
In accordance with the documents incorporated by reference in Regulation .02 of this chapter, employees and applicants for employment are subject to:
Disciplinary actions for violations of these regulations.
In this chapter, the following documents are incorporated by reference.
14 CFR §61.14 (1993), as amended and published in 59 FR 7388—7389 (1994).
14 CFR §63.12b (1993), as amended and published in 59 FR 7389 (1994).
14 CFR §65.23 (1993), as amended and published in 59 FR 7389 (1994).
14 CFR §§65.46a and 65.46b, as published in 59 FR 7389 (1994).
14 CFR §§121.458 and 121.459 and 14 CFR 121, Appendix J, as published in 59 FR 7389—7396 (1994).
14 CFR §135.1 (1993), as amended and published in 59 FR 7396 (1994).
49 CFR §392.5 (1993), and the amendments published in 59 FR 7514—7515 (1994).
"On-duty time" as defined in 49 CFR §395.2(8), as published in 59 FR 7515 (1994).
